crazyballrun.game

Class GameFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.GameFunctions

  • public class GameFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameFunctions class overs access to main game functionality, like 'accelerate current player', 'use break for player' and many more. The functions are implemented for both, singleplayer and multiplayer mode and any game setting. The game functions have to be initialized with each start/change of level to get access to the players, objects and the whole physical environment. The GameFunctions is mainly used by the EventMapper which reacts on user input (therefore maps events on actions). GameFunctions provides a method perform() for that purpose. It contains one element of "Action"-enumeration for argument. All of the private methods called by perform()-method have no parameters, so the behaviour is completely defined by the enumeration-name specified for the action and the private methods itself. Thus, the GameFunctions have access to every game engine: PhysicsEngine to manipulate physics, NetworkEngine to write chat- messages, GUIEngine to offer a "pause/continue"-menu, etc. For a translation of String-actions to enumeration-actions the GameFunctions class provides the method translate().

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GameFunctions.Action
      Enumeration of all possible actions the GameFunctions-class offers to external users.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String[] sActions
      Display names of the actions (for graphical user interface).
      static Player[] sPlayer
      Contains all players of the currently loaded map (the array is filled by the LevelEngine after parsing).

      This player-specific array showes if the "backward-acceleration"-action is being performed by the player.
      static boolean[] sPlayerAccelerate
      This player-specific array showes if the "acceleration"-action is being performed by the player.
      static int[] sPlayerNumber
      Player number specifies the corresponding player-tag in the level-file.
      static boolean[] sPlayerTurnLeft
      This player-specific array showes if the "turn left"-action is being performed by the player.
      static boolean[] sPlayerTurnRight
      This player-specific array showes if the "turn right"-action is being performed by the player.

    • Field Detail

      • sPlayer

        public static Player[] sPlayer
        Contains all players of the currently loaded map (the array is filled by the LevelEngine after parsing).

      • sPlayerNumber

        public static int[] sPlayerNumber
        Player number specifies the corresponding player-tag in the level-file. For event-action-mapping the main player is player "0" but its player- number may be any of the players specified the level-file.

      • sPlayerTurnLeft

        public static boolean[] sPlayerTurnLeft
        This player-specific array showes if the "turn left"-action is being performed by the player.

      • sPlayerTurnRight

        public static boolean[] sPlayerTurnRight
        This player-specific array showes if the "turn right"-action is being performed by the player.

      • sPlayerAccelerate

        public static boolean[] sPlayerAccelerate
        This player-specific array showes if the "acceleration"-action is being performed by the player.

      • sPlayerAccBackwards

        public static boolean[] sPlayerAccBackwards
        This player-specific array showes if the "backward-acceleration"-action is being performed by the player.

      • sActions

        public static java.lang.String[] sActions
        Display names of the actions (for graphical user interface).

        Returns:

      • translate

        public static GameFunctions.Action translate(java.lang.String action)
        Translates a string into an element from the Action-enumeration.
        Parameters:
        action - string-representation of the action
        Returns:
        an element of the Action-enumeration fitting to the action-argument.

      • perform

        public static void perform(GameFunctions.Action action)
        Calls a particular private method to perform the specified action. Those actions may not be player-specific or position-dependent.
        Parameters:
        action - action to perform

        content - event content
